image.altText: Stan Grant

items.synopsis: The veteran journalist will be taking up a new position with Monash University to lead a conversation "about how media can foster a more constructive and kinder discourse".

title.children: Stan Grant leaves ABC after being subjected to 'relentless' racial abuse

image.altText: James Hayward walking outside WA parliament.

items.synopsis: The mother of the girl alleged to have been sexually abused by a WA MP tells a Perth court she messaged him saying "leave me and my family alone" after learning of the allegations, despite earlier not disclosing she contacted him.

title.children: Mother of child allegedly indecently assaulted by WA MP denies trying to mislead court

image.altText: A man in a suit looks at the camera

items.synopsis: Adam Cranston, the son of former Australian Tax Office deputy commissioner, is jailed for his role in a $105 million tax evasion conspiracy he ran with his sister and three others.

title.children: Son of former ATO deputy commissioner jailed over $105m tax evasion scheme

image.altText: Colour photo of Crispin Dye smiling and playing a guitar in an undated photo

items.synopsis: Crispin Dye, a former manager of the Australian rock band, died 30 years ago after he was found in Sydney with severe head injuries.

title.children: DNA test of AC/DC manager's bloody jeans provides new person of interest over his death 30 years ago

image.altText: A young girl lying in a hospital bed

items.synopsis: Police charge a 49-year-old woman over a hit-and-run crash in Perth's southern suburbs that left 12-year-old Alexis Lloyd with serious injuries.

title.children: Woman charged over hit-and-run crash that left schoolgirl with broken leg and collarbone

image.altText: A still from a social media video showing an 18-year-old man being arrested in Taree.

items.synopsis: The aunt of an Indigenous teen whose arrest is under an internal police investigation has lodged an official complaint with the police watchdog.

title.children: Family calls for 'justice' following 'shocking' arrest of young Indigenous man

image.altText: exterior of ballarat clarendon college with sign

items.synopsis: The video, captured during an online class with year 12 students, includes audio of the teacher yelling and swearing while providing feedback on student English essays.

title.children: Teacher at top Victorian private school resigns after expletive-filled rant shared on social media

image.altText: An elderly woman in a white bucket hat

items.synopsis: The town of Waroona on WA's South West Highway, the commercial centre of a sprawling shire of 835 square kilometres, will soon be left with no bricks-and-mortar bank, nor 24-hour cash machine, with NAB set to close its branch in November.

title.children: WA community faces 'scary' future as last remaining bank, 24-hour ATM leaves town

image.altText: The Gabba redevelopment north-eastern view ahead of the 2023 Brisbane Olympic Games, stadium in background fans in foreground

items.synopsis: The multi-billion-dollar redevelopment of the Gabba stadium in Brisbane, which will see a heritage-listed school knocked down, was not necessary to host the 2032 Olympic Games, Australian Olympic Committee CEO reveals.

title.children: 'Not actually required': AOC boss questioned over $2.7 billion decision to rebuild the Gabba

image.altText: A tall tree surrounded by fencing with mesh.

items.synopsis: The tree is in the vicinity of a controversial Victorian road upgrade, but authorities say it will not be affected by the project.

title.children: Sacred birthing tree spray-painted with words 'build the road' confirmed to have been poisoned

image.altText: Bruce Bonyhady wearing a suit and tie and smiling.

items.synopsis: One of the original architects of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) says it is being treated as a "limitless Magic Pudding" and local, state and territory governments need to do more to support all people living with disability.

title.children: More children on NDIS than intended, expert says, flagging an 'urgent rethink' of the way kids are supported

image.altText: Thaksin Shinawatra with his sister Yingluck on a plane

items.synopsis: The return of a billionaire fugitive will set the stage for one of the most dramatic days in Thai political history. Here's what you need to know about former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra.

title.children: The billionaire patriarch of Thailand's fabled political dynasty has returned home to be arrested. Here's why

image.altText: a man looks at a picture frame

items.synopsis: Corrie Luk wishes voluntary assisted dying had been an option during the last stage of his wife Keery's spiral into dementia. Tragic memories of her death spur him on in the fight to amend the state's euthanasia laws.

title.children: After watching his wife die of dementia, Corrie wants WA's voluntary assisted dying laws changed

image.altText: An Australian batter plays to the leg side during a men's Ashes Test against England at Headingley.

items.synopsis: Steve Smith details how he batted through the final three Tests of the men’s Ashes with tendon damage in his left wrist after being injured while fielding during the second match of the series.

title.children: Steve Smith reveals his 'quite painful' Ashes injury

image.altText: A group of 10 family members walking outside a court building

items.synopsis: Adelaide's District Court has heard victim impact statements from the family of Giuseppe Macheda who was driving his tractor out the front of his property when a car smashed into him throwing him into a flooded culvert.

title.children: Family of farmer killed by drunk driver tells court crash scene was like a 'Hollywood horror movie'

image.altText: A Russian bomber engulfed in flames at an airbase

items.synopsis: Images posted on social media show a Russian supersonic bomber engulfed in flames following a drone strike.

title.children: Ukrainian drone destroys Russian supersonic bomber

image.altText: Xi Jinping raises his glass and proposes a toast while standing behind a lecturn in front of Chinese flags.

items.synopsis: For much of the past 15 years, China has been developing a weapon that now has become increasingly unstable and that threatens to detonate from within, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: Turning Japanese: Why China could be heading for a fall

image.altText: ABC Chair Designate Ita Buttrose.

items.synopsis: The communications minister confirms Ita Buttrose's time as chair of the ABC will end in March next year, when her term is complete.

title.children: ABC chair Ita Buttrose will not seek reappointment in 2024

image.altText: Leaves in the foreground with a woman sitting out of focus in the background.

items.synopsis: She thought it was a scam phone call, but it was a mother's worst nightmare, her daughter was an alleged victim of a paedophile child care worker.

title.children: When Jane discovered her daughter was the victim of alleged child abuse, she found it hard not to blame herself

image.altText: a graphic of Chinese and Taiwanese flags

items.synopsis: Ten Australian MPs are set to arrive in Taiwan late next month as part of a cross-party delegation for talks expected to largely focus on trade, with Beijing keeping a close eye on the visit.

title.children: Australian MPs preparing for trip to Taiwan, with visit to be closely watched by Beijing

image.altText: 2019 Menindee drought Darling

items.synopsis: Water Minister Tanya Plibersek says the government has brokered a deal to rewrite the Murray-Darling Basin plan, but leaves Victoria out of the new agreement.

title.children: Plibersek brokers new Murray-Darling Basin deal without Victoria

image.altText: A close up of Cortnee looking serious on the pitch.

items.synopsis: After writing her name into Australian sporting folklore with her ice-cool penalty at the Women's World Cup, Matildas star Cortnee Vine is set to continue thrilling local crowds after extending her contract with Sydney FC.

title.children: 'A real coup': Matildas World Cup hero re-signs with A-League Women champions

image.altText: Mark Latham and Pauline Hanson

items.synopsis: NSW upper house MPs Mark Latham and Rod Roberts announced they have resigned from One Nation and Mr Latham has tabled a letter in parliament alleging the party tried to funnel money from the NSW Electoral Commission.

title.children: Mark Latham quits One Nation, accuses party of 'defrauding NSW electoral funds'

image.altText: Hard of hearing, expert on cochlear

items.synopsis: The full scope of a cochlear implant bungle is only now becoming clear, after more than 15 years of going undetected at a major public children's hospital — and there are unanswered questions about how far the ramifications might reach.

title.children: Cochlear implant bungle went undiagnosed for more than 15 years, but what happens now?

image.altText: Coles supermarket sign close up

items.synopsis: Woodside Energy makes a $2.7 billion profit in six months, and Coles profits are up 4.8pc, amid high inflation and cost-of-living pressures — as it happened.

title.children: Woodside Energy posts record $2.7b half-year profit, Coles profits up 4.8pc — as it happened

image.altText: An elderly woman clutches a teddy as she wears a life vest and is rescued by firefighters

items.synopsis: Southern Californians are cleaning up damage and debris after the state's first tropical storm since 1939.

title.children: Pictures capture damage and rescue efforts after Tropical Storm Hilary

image.altText: Men's legs with rainbow socks and football boots

items.synopsis: Not a single elite male AFL player has ever come out publicly as gay or bisexual. This is what happened when Four Corners tried to ask about the silence.

title.children: We tried to tackle the AFL's last great taboo. The code got defensive

image.altText: A group of men in white hazard suits, masks and yellow helmets stand beside a group of large, green-grey water tanks.

items.synopsis: The plan's opponents range from scientists who question the reasoning behind the government's actions to local fishermen who fear renewed damage to their industry's reputation.

title.children: Japan has a plan to deal with wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear plant. Here's why it's facing so much opposition

image.altText: A composite image of many colourful socks tied to a security fence, and two teen girls in school uniforms.

items.synopsis: A school assignment turns into a highly visible community campaign for improvements to an empty office building in Kalamunda's town centre, labelled the "pigeon hotel" by locals.

title.children: Students demand action on derelict Perth office building with 'put a sock on it' campaign

image.altText: A smiling man in a dark suit waves with his right palm raised.

items.synopsis: Cambodia's National Assembly unanimously votes to endorse the eldest son of strongman leader Hun Sen — who has been in power nearly 40 years — as the country's new prime minister.

title.children: Cambodian parliament unanimously endorses son of strongman leader Hun Sen as new prime minister

image.altText: A map of the world

items.synopsis: The Indian Ocean's version of El Niño — a positive Indian Ocean Dipole — typically brings a reduction in rainfall and an increase in temperatures through winter and spring.

title.children: Hot and dry weather in Australia may soon be the result of another weather event — not just El Niño

image.altText: A dingo walks across a beach.

items.synopsis: A wildlife expert says reducing the number of serious dingo attacks on the world heritage sand island of K'gari is going to be difficult.

title.children: 'As good as we can get it': Serious dingo attacks on K'gari prove difficult to reduce

image.altText: Stephen Gageler looks into the distance

items.synopsis: Justice Gageler, the most senior justice after Chief Justice Kiefel, will assume her role when the incumbent retires in November.

title.children: Stephen Gageler to replace Susan Kiefel as High Court chief justice

image.altText: Man wearing a suit looks into the camera as he walks into a room, two police officers walking in front of him

items.synopsis: Posting on his social media platform Truth Social, former US president Donald Trump says he plans to turn himself in.

title.children: Trump says he will travel to Georgia to be arrested

image.altText: A US dollar note is pictured alongside an Australian 10 dollar and 20 dollar bill.

items.synopsis: For foreign tourists? Great. For travellers? Terrible. For the economy? A mix. The fall in the Australian dollar has created winners and losers across the economy.

title.children: The Aussie dollar could slump below 60 US cents, bringing with it pain and gain
